title: [Large-Scale] Robotics Project-Based Programming and Software Design Course: Social Collaboration and Technology Integration

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of introductory programming concepts and algorithms, and basic awareness of how technological advancements impact social structures
context.additional_context: Individual use of robot simulation tools and PBL-based team projects. Includes activities exploring the impact of technological advancements on cultural and institutional changes during the project process.

learning_goals: Learners can write software design documents to solve real-world robot control problems and analyze the impact of technological advancements on social institutions.

Applying systematic procedures for analyzing unstructured problems, learners can complete robot project tasks and evaluate the impact of technological innovation on citizens' rights and relationships.
Through collaboration, learners can implement robot applications using open-source hardware platforms and explore technology cooperation models in global economic and political environments.
Learners can assess self-efficacy in problem-solving processes, propose improvement strategies, and consider the impact of technological advancements on individual and societal safety.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
